case_vignette: A 7-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his mother for the evaluation of abdominal pain and trouble sleeping for the past 6 months. His mother says he complains of crampy abdominal pain every morning on school days. He started attending a new school 7 months ago and she is concerned because he has missed school frequently due to the abdominal pain. He also has trouble falling asleep at night and asks to sleep in the same room with his parents every night. He has not had fever, vomiting, diarrhea, or weight loss. He sits very close to his mother and starts to cry when she steps out of the room to take a phone call. Abdominal examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having stomach aches every morning on school days and I'm having trouble sleeping at night.
How old are you?
I am 7 years old.
Are you experiencing these stomach aches on weekends or holidays as well?
No, just on school days.
Do you have any nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or fever accompanying the stomach aches?
No, I don't have any of those.
Have there been any changes at school or at home recently, like bullying, a new teacher, or family stress?
I started attending a new school 7 months ago.
Do the stomach aches improve after you arrive at school or do they last throughout the day?
My mom didn't say if the stomachaches got better after I get to school.
How has your appetite been? Are you eating less or normally?
I haven't lost any weight, so I guess I'm eating normally.
Do you feel worried or anxious about going to school?
My mom is worried because I've been missing school a lot due to my stomach aches.
Have you had any problems with your classmates or teachers that make you feel uneasy about going to school?
My mom didn't say anything about having problems with classmates or teachers.
Is there any history of gastrointestinal disorders in your family?
My mom didn't mention anything about that.
Do you find it difficult to make friends or feel scared to participate in school activities?
My mom didn't say anything about me having trouble making friends or being scared at school activities.
Have you started any new medications or had any recent illnesses?
No, I haven't started any new medications or had any recent illnesses.
Final Diagnosis: School avoidance or school-related anxiety.
